name: Mann's Planet
description: A perilous, icy world featured in the film 'Interstellar', known for its false beacon of hope.

content.title: History
content.body: Mann's Planet was one of the twelve planets surveyed by the Lazarus missions. It was named after Dr. Mann, the leader of the expedition who wrongly reported it as a habitable planet in a desperate attempt to be rescued.

content.title: Geography
content.body: The planet is characterized by vast icy landscapes and frigid temperatures. It exhibits unstable ice formations, large chasms, and a barren surface with a thin atmosphere.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
- **Dr. Mann's Base**: The outpost where Dr. Mann spent years in hyper-sleep awaiting rescue.
- **Cracked Ice Fields**: Treacherous terrain that Cooper and his team travel across.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Mann's Planet serves as a significant plot point in 'Interstellar'. It is where Cooper and his crew confront Dr. Mann, leading to a sequence of dramatic events that highlight themes of survival and sacrifice.
